p: Recent papers have described acute CNS-associated symptoms in patients affected with SARS-CoV-2, specially neurological ones such as loss of smell and taste, strokes, delirium, viral encephalitis, toxic encephalopathy ( Moriguchi et al., 2020) and acute hemorrhagic necrotizing encephalopathy ( Poyiadji et al., 2020). From a psychiatric point of view, studies are focused on the influence of the coronavirus pandemic on health workers´ mental health, grief and emotional effects on general population. Unfortunately, less attention has been paid on the involvement of this virus in the development of new onset psychotic episodes ( Valdés-Florido et al., 2020).
